title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message: liquid spill, both usb-c ports were stained with cranberry juice, and replacing both revived the MacBook. Works 100% other than these key problems. I haven't dived into the caps lock led yet. Just the three keys that don't work. I'm focusing right now on U6703 for these three. There's 3.3v coming in on pin 10. Pins 1-3 KBD_RIGHT_SHIFT_KEY, KBD_LEFT_OPTION_KEY, KBD_CONTROL_KEY all have zero volts. Pins 7-9 each has 1.8v. Pin 4 has 1.8, and pin 6 has zero volts. On a whim I replaced U6703 and same results. What's the distinction between   KBD_RIGHT_SHIFT_KEY    and     KBD_RIGHT_SHIFT_L  ?

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
Check diode mode to ground on U6703 inputs, w/ and w/o keyboard connected.

To properly check amy key:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?q=keyboard+tester&client=firefox-b-d&bih=615&biw=1408&hl=es&ei=3vfeYdiSCcCNjLsP8t29IA&ved=0ahUKEwjY-aXNx6z1AhXABmMBHfJuDwQQ4dUDCA0&uact=5&oq=keyboard+tester&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz[/URL]
I prefer to use
[URL unfurl="true"]https://en.key-test.ru/[/URL]

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
thanks for that
in diode mode, input pins 1-3 all register ~1.83v with and without keyboard connected

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
Please, read how to properly check diode mode:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
ok, thank you,  
input pins 1-3 all register ~.485v with and without keyboard connected

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
Try another keyboard.
Do you get 1.8V at pin 1 of J6701?

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
different keyboard, same result. diode check is done without power connected, right?
and yes I get 1.8v pin 1 of J6701

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message: All the other keys tested in browser, as above mentioned?

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message: yes, done, all other keys work

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
Remove DZ6701 and test again.
Be sure to have good solders and traces at U6703.

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message: all three are ~.472v  after DZ6701 removed

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
Change U6703 again.
Be sure to get good solders and check its traces to KB connector.

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
[ATTACH type="full" width="287px"]60371[/ATTACH]
the kb connector is just reverse of this, that area is in perfect condition. I found another U6703 and re-soldered it. The input pin diode measurements are all .482-.485v. However, I do not get any voltage on the corresponding pins of the keyboard connector. DZ6701 is still removed

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message: by the way, those two bare areas bottom left of the pads are copper trace, I scraped them just enough to see a little shine-- **and there is continuity between pin 4 and the resistor it leads to**

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message: so I re-soldered DZ6701, and checked the kb connector pins and still 0. I found another DZ6701 and soldered it and still 0v for the three inputs on the kb connector. I get 1.8v still on U6703 pins 7-9, and basically still 0 on pins 1-3.

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
Possibly bad contacts at J6701; maybe crap underneath.

Check voltage on similar pins of keyboard connector from another board.

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
contacts look clean
I compared U6703 voltages on a board from a working system and found that pin 6 should have 3.3v but our board in question is almost zero. this must be significant, yes?

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
Yes, reset output should be high.
That's the reason I suspected U6703.
Just in case, check R6752 and R8014.

On the other board, all 3 inputs have 0V?

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message: yes all three inputs on the board from the working system are also 0V. after my last message I checked out R6752 and it was low and it basically broke off while I was testing, so I replaced it and now 3.3V on pin 6 reset output of U6703. Also R8014 now has 3.3V on both pins. but still no voltage on the kb connector.

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message: I was going to test R6703 and it's missing. let me replace that and post back here

title: 820-01700 2019 A2141, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
message:
I replaced R6703. And then discovered pins 28-30 on the keyboard connector don't get voltage. So I decided to connect the board to a keyboard and test it and all three keys plus the caps lock LED now work
thank you for your help!!
